SEARCH
Package examblock.model

Class ListManager<T extends ManageableListItem & StreamManager>

Object
ListManager<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of items under management, extending ManageableListItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
StreamManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExamList, RoomList, SessionList, StudentList, SubjectList, UnitList, VenueList
public abstract class ListManager<T extends ManageableListItem & StreamManager> extends Object implements StreamManager
Abstract class to manage lists of items implementing ManageableListItem. Maintains its own list of items, using the Registry for ID-based lookup and validation. Items are assumed to register themselves with the registry upon creation, so this class manages list membership independently.

    • ListManager

      ListManager(ItemFactory<T> factory, Registry registry, Class<T> itemType)
      Constructs a new ListManager with an empty item list.
      Parameters:
      factory - a ManageableListItem for the given type
      registry - the registry for item lookup
      itemType - the class of the items (e.g., Exam.class)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if registry or itemType is null

  • Method Details

    • getItems

      public List<T> getItems()
      Gets the managed list of items.
      Returns:
      the list of items

    • add

      public void add(T item)
      Adds an item to the list if it is registered in the Registry. The item is assumed to have registered itself upon creation.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the item is not registered
      NullPointerException - if the item is null

    • remove

      public void remove(T item)
      Removes an item from the list.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to remove

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all items from the list and the Registry.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of items in the list.
      Returns:
      the size of the list

    • all

      public ArrayList<T> all()
      Returns a copy of the list of all managed items.
      Returns:
      a new ArrayList containing all items

    • addAll

      public void addAll(ArrayList<T> source)
      Replaces the contents of this list with the provided items, ensuring all are registered.
      Parameters:
      source - the list of items to add
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if any item is not registered

    • streamIn

      public void streamIn(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Reads data from disk, populating the list by constructing items of the appropriate type. Items register themselves with the Registry during construction.
      Specified by:
      streamIn in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      br - reader, already opened
      registry - the global registry (ignored, uses own)
      nthItem - position in the stream
      Throws:
      IOException - if a stream error occurs
      RuntimeException - if the file format is invalid

    • streamOut

      public void streamOut(BufferedWriter bw, int nthItem) throws IOException
      Writes the list's contents to the provided BufferedWriter. Outputs a header with the pluralized class name and size, followed by each item's streamed output, and a trailing newline.
      Specified by:
      streamOut in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      bw - the BufferedWriter to write to
      nthItem - the index of the item (ignored in this implementation)
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • find

      public abstract T find(String key)
      Finds an item by a key (e.g., ID).
      Parameters:
      key - the text used to identify the item
      Returns:
      the item if found or null otherwise

    • get

      Parameters:
      key - the text used to identify the item
      Returns:
      the item if found
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no item is found
